Sentencas: In situ exsolved nanoparticles on metal oxide materials have received much attention in catalysis due to their well socketed structure and high catalytic activity.
Titulo: Self-assembled alloy nanoparticles in a layered double perovskite as a fuel oxidation catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Recently, the demand for active nanoparticles with multiple functionalities in catalysis has increased, so exsolutions of intermetallic nanoparticles could be an effective strategy to meet the requirements.
Titulo: Self-assembled alloy nanoparticles in a layered double perovskite as a fuel oxidation catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, for the first time, we report exsolved Co-Ni alloy nanoparticles and their Gibbs free energy of alloy formation in a PrBaMn1.7Co0.1Ni0.2O5+delta layered double perovskite.
Titulo: Self-assembled alloy nanoparticles in a layered double perovskite as a fuel oxidation catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These exsolved alloy nanoparticles have a high catalytic performance for fuel oxidation in fuel cells and in the dry reforming of methane.
Titulo: Self-assembled alloy nanoparticles in a layered double perovskite as a fuel oxidation catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, we probed the mechanism of the alloy formation in the exsolution using density functional theory (DFT).
Titulo: Self-assembled alloy nanoparticles in a layered double perovskite as a fuel oxidation catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The theoretical calculations reveal that the Gibbs free energy of the surface alloy formation (Delta G(aggr_surface)) is more favorable than that of the bulk alloy formation (Delta G(aggr_bulk)), indicating that Co and Ni are exsolved separately from the bulk, and then aggregate to form a Co-Ni alloy on the surface.
Titulo: Self-assembled alloy nanoparticles in a layered double perovskite as a fuel oxidation catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells
